header.title: ESOTERIC EXTENSION OF TAROT TO DEVELOP SUPERSENSORY POWERS

central_thesis: The text posits that developing supersensory powers and achieving spiritual unfoldment involves understanding and properly relating to one's personality, not by denying it, but by gaining a correct perspective and a humorous, objective awareness of its foibles, ultimately leading to the recognition of a larger Self and the dominion of spirit over illusion and separateness.

structure_content.chapter_title: LESSON 41: Transcriptions from Ann Davies' Class Lectures
structure_content.summary: This lesson, part of a series on developing supersensory powers through Tarot, focuses on understanding the personality in the context of spiritual growth. It argues that separateness, often perceived as 'evil' or 'the devil,' is a result of ignorance and a lack of recognition of underlying unity. The text introduces Qabalistic concepts and Tarot Key 15 (The Devil) as a stage of spiritual unfoldment. It emphasizes that the personality is a tool of the Higher Self and should not be taken too seriously, advocating for a humorous and objective perspective to overcome limitations and illusions. A practical technique involving Tarot Key 15 is provided to help practitioners assert spiritual dominion over perceived evil and separateness.

key_concepts.definition: The author views the personality as a 'marvelous instrument' created by the life power and the Higher Self. It is a manifestation of the Divine, an expression of a given state of consciousness. The core challenge is to avoid becoming emotionally involved or overly identified with it, which leads to egoism and limitation. The key is to understand its 'foibles' and maintain an objective, often humorous, perspective.

Identified as the essence of 'the devil' and the cause of 'shadow' within consciousness. Separateness is the lack of realization of the unity among all beings, all life, all matter, and the entire universe. It stems from ignorance and leads to reactions based on partial pictures and egoistic pride.

The 'name of God' and the ultimate reality that underlies all existence. Recognizing this unity is the antidote to separateness and egoism. It is the awareness that transcends sensory perception and is accessible through consciousness.

The process of evolving one's consciousness towards a higher level. Qabalistically, the text associates Key 15 (The Devil) with the first stage of spiritual unfoldment, described as 'hellish' but offering a profound message of overcoming limitations through perspective and mirth. It is a journey from ignorance and egoism towards recognition of the Self and unity.

A crucial tool for achieving proper perspective on the personality and the world. The author suggests approaching the personality with the same 'indulgent humor' given to a child or pet. Mirth is presented as the 'Renewing Intelligence' and the most wholesome thing in life, essential for overcoming bondage and achieving objectivity.

The ability to see things objectively and accurately, particularly regarding the personality. It involves 'weighing and measuring relative values correctly' and understanding the role of the personality within the larger consciousness. Proper perspective allows one to 'chuckle' at the foibles of the personality and situations, distinguishing true importance from trivial concerns.

Represented as 'separateness,' 'ignorance,' and 'the father of lies.' However, it is also framed as a crucial stage in spiritual unfoldment that must be confronted and understood, not denied. The operative technique associated with this key aims to reverse its symbolism from one of bondage and illusion to one of spiritual dominion.

practical_system.description: The practical system involves a psychological and energetic reorientation towards the concept of the personality and its relationship to the Self. It advocates for developing an objective, detached, yet humorous perspective on one's own personality and the personalities of others. This detachment is achieved through understanding that the personality is an instrument, not the ultimate reality. The core practice involves confronting and transforming the symbolic representation of 'evil' or 'separateness' (Tarot Key 15, The Devil) through visualization and affirmation, asserting spiritual dominion over illusion and bondage.
tools: Blue-violet color (for aura filling and permeation)
rituals: Approach the image of The Devil (Key 15) with a specific address: 'You fraud! You trickster! You father of lies!'
Mentally levitate to the Devil's head and 'snatch' the inverted pentagram.
Reverse the pentagram to its upright position, symbolizing the spirit's dominion.
Direct the light from the upright pentagram towards the Devil figure, causing astonishment.
Expel the Devil figure (represented as 'roused in flight') while pronouncements of spiritual dominion are made.

Point the pentagram at the symbolic figures of subconsciousness (female) and self-consciousness (male) on the Key, visualizing penetration of light which dissolves their 'horns' and 'tails' (symbols of bondage).
Verbally release the figures from bondage and instruct them to remove their chains.
Hold the pentagram and permeate oneself again in blue-violet.

Recite the affirmation: 'I thank you, Holy Guardian Angel, for awakening me to the dominion of the light over the darkness in me and in my environment. I now begin to see through the appearance of separateness that is responsible for all illusion. I can now love my personality, laugh at my personality, scold my personality because I have found my Self.'

relevant_quotes.text: That is why you have often heard it said that the name of the devil is legion. It is separateness, the lack of realization of the unity among us all, despite the differences. That is the devil, whereas the name of God is the unity of all. The shadow that we are in is due to our concentrated separateness.

We are not trying to destroy the personality. We are, however, trying to reach a correct perspective in our view of personality, this marvelous instrument which the life power and your Higher Self have grown.

Not taking the personality seriously means not making the kind of identification we have just mentioned; identification that makes it so important to us to strut and peacock. This pompous exhibitionism is what some call the insanity of humanity.
The way to look at the personality with the proper perspective is with the same indulgent humor that we give to a child or a pet.

This is the secret of release from bondage, because you can do that only as you attain the advantage of perspective. You would love to say things like that about yourself, but you are afraid to because you have been taught that it is egotistical.
Learn to laugh, to accept your personality, to indulge it, to scold it, to dramatize it.

critical_analysis.relevance: This text is highly relevant to practitioners of Western Esotericism, particularly those interested in psychological approaches to magic and spiritual development. It bridges Qabalistic thought with practical Tarot application, offering a non-dualistic perspective on 'evil' and the personality. The emphasis on humor and objectivity provides a modern, accessible counterpoint to more severe ascetic practices often found in occult literature. It is particularly useful for understanding the psychological underpinnings of spiritual growth and the role of the ego in magical work.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The target audience includes advanced students of esoteric subjects, particularly those familiar with Tarot, Qabalah, and general occult philosophy. It is suitable for individuals seeking to develop their spiritual awareness and supersensory abilities through self-understanding and psychological integration rather than solely external rituals or dogma. Practitioners interested in the psychological aspects of magic and personal transformation would find this material beneficial.
